question: お疲れ様
sourceMnemonic: You are a <ja>疲れ</ja> (tired) <ja>様</ja> (honorific that kind of refers to whoever's being mentioned with this word). You say this to people after a day of hard work or after a good practice, etc. <ja>お疲れ様でした</ja>! I suppose the assumption here is that everyone worked until they were tired, so it was a good work, and then you thank them for it and mention how tired everyone is.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading comes from <ja>疲れ</ja> and <ja>様</ja>, combined together into one word.
